fit(y, X=None, **fit_args)¶

Fit the transformer

The purpose of the fit method is to learn a set of statistics or characteristics from the training set, and store them as “fit attributes” within the instance. A transformer must be fit before the transformation can be applied to a dataset in the transform method.

yarray-like or None, shape=(n_samples,)

The endogenous (time-series) array.

Xarray-like or None, shape=(n_samples, n_features)

The exogenous array of additional covariates.

selfBaseTransformer

The scikit-learn convention is for the fit method to return the instance of the transformer, self. This allows us to string fit(...).transform(...) calls together.

transform(y, X=None, **kwargs)¶

Transform the new array

Apply the transformation to the array after learning the training set’s characteristics in the fit method.

yarray-like or None, shape=(n_samples,)

The endogenous (time-series) array.

Xarray-like or None, shape=(n_samples, n_features)

The exogenous array of additional covariates.

**kwargskeyword args

Keyword arguments required by the transform function.

yarray-like or None

The transformed y array

Xarray-like or None

The transformed X array
